meanings.definition: Have a close similarity; match or agree almost exactly.
meanings.sent1: The colors of the two paintings correspond perfectly.
meanings.sent2: Their answers corresponded with each other.
meanings.sent3: The twins' outfits corresponded so well that they looked like mirror images.
meanings.sent4: Her actions correspond with her words, showing her integrity.
meanings.sent5: The rhythm of the music seemed to correspond with the beating of my heart.

meanings.definition: Communicate by exchanging letters with someone.
meanings.sent1: I correspond with my pen pal who lives in another country.
meanings.sent3: The old-fashioned way to correspond was through handwritten letters.
meanings.sent4: She used to correspond with her lover through romantic notes.
meanings.sent5: In the past, people would correspond by sending letters by post.

meanings.definition: Be equivalent to; be in harmony with.
meanings.sent1: The total cost should correspond to the estimate provided.
meanings.sent2: His actions do not correspond with his words.
meanings.sent3: The taste of the dish did not correspond with the description on the menu.
meanings.sent4: Her mood seemed to correspond with the weather outside.
meanings.sent5: The level of effort you put in should correspond with the results you achieve.
